intent_atoms.description: Integrate SwiftFormat enforcement into the development workflow to automatically format Swift code before commits and validate formatting in CI.
Pre-commit hook runs swift format --in-place on all staged Swift files and fails commit if formatter modifies files.
CI workflow includes a swift-format-check job that lints Sources and Tests directories, failing with clear error message when unformatted code is detected.
All Swift files in Sources/ and Tests/ are formatted to 2-space indentation, consistent spacing, trailing commas, line length adjustments, and whitespace normalization.
Documentation includes a Code Formatting section with local formatting instructions, lint-only verification command, pre-commit hook setup guide, CI enforcement behavior explanation, and examples.

SwiftLint violations are resolved to zero by disabling conflicting rules (opening_brace, closure_parameter_position, trailing_comma) and aligning .swift-format configuration with SwiftLint expectations.
The pre-commit hook must not break existing swiftlint and build checks.
CI workflow must run on Ubuntu 22.04 using Swift 6.0 toolchain.
Rename existing swift-format-foundationui hook to swift-build-foundationui for clarity.
Add new swift-format-all hook that runs swift format --in-place on all staged Swift (i.e., the ..???)
